title: OTN HFX Line Offloads
comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider is also equipped with an Innovasea MobileRX and VMT attached to the towbody with both hydrophone heads pointing backwards, an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, an Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull, and float-mounted Teledyne RDI 600kHz Workhorse Monitor ADCP and Seabird GPCTD+DO. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers making up the OTN Halifax Line.

deployment_details.deployment_personnel: L'Orsa S, Allan J, Neriuoka N, Keogh P, Gradin I
deployment_details.recovery_personnel: Byrne T, Gradin I, Lynch F

raw_relationship.comment: 43-3151 set-up with GPCTD 701-0328 for 2025 Offloads West mission. Mounted underneath SV3-1070 float.

instrument.comment:
Pumped CTD with optional SBE 43F dissolved oxygen sensor. Mounted underneath float.

Original pump S/N: 05-10022 and DO S/N: 3962

2025 was put with pump 05-10304 and DO 43-3151.

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1026/

sensor.comment:
600m depth limit, plastic housing.
model: 43F

Sea-Bird polarographic membrane sensor (fast response) for SBE Integrated CTD-DO profilers. Temperature-compensated oxygen signal is a frequency output.

raw_relationship.comment: VM4 mounted in towbody for 2025 Offloads West mission.

instrument.comment:
VR4-UWM specifically designed to be mounted on a wave glider. Dual receiver channel frequencies - 69 kHz and 180 kHz and benthos underwater modem. 

Towed from the Wave Glider sub on a towfish several meters below water.

instrument.long_name: Teledyne RDI 600kHz Workhorse Monitor direct-reading ADCP
instrument.comment:
Workhorse Monitor ADCP 600 kHz, 4 beams, orientation down
beam angle 20 degrees, beam pattern convex, bottom tracking enabled
Sensors: Heading, Tilt 1, Tilt 2, Temperature
Temp Sens Offset: 0.08 degrees C

http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL1025/

raw_relationship.comment: Mounted on towbody fin with hydrophone head pointing backwards for 2025 Offloads West mission.

instrument.comment: Tag ID: 54904, MAP-114, Never Tx. Programmed for high power only, with a random ping interval centered on 2 min (60 – 180s).

instrument.comment: Mobile RX on loan from Innovasea for 2025 Offloads West mission.

raw_data.title: OTN HFX Line Offloads
raw_data.comment:
A Liquid Robotics SV3 v300 Wave Glider was deployed with a towed Innovasea VM4-WG with the ability to offload Innovasea VR4 acoustic receivers. The glider is also equipped with an Innovasea MobileRX and VMT attached to the towbody with both hydrophone heads pointing backwards, an Airmar 200WX weather station and Liquid Robotics GPSWaves wave height sensor mounted to masts on top of the float, an Airmar DX900+ water speed sensor mounted forward thru-hull, and float-mounted Teledyne RDI 600kHz Workhorse Monitor ADCP and Seabird GPCTD+DO. 

The glider will offload VR4 receivers making up the OTN Halifax Line.
